conclusion: Determine the length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface.
The car headlight is located at a height of 92.8 cm above the ground.
The light source is at the focal point F of the parabolic reflector.
The light travels along the parabola and then enters the hemispherical lens perpendicular to its vertical diameter MN.
The equation of a parabola with focus at F and directrix parallel to the ground can be written as y = x^2/(4f).
Focal length f is half of the headlight height, so f = 46.4 cm.
The refractive index of the hemispherical lens is n = 4/3.
When light enters the lens perpendicular to MN, it travels along the radius of the hemisphere.
The length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN is the radius R of the hemisphere.
The length of the transparent part is R.
